BotBestPushesS_Penalties Class Reference

Management of cost penalties. Try to detect every sub-states that causes a penalty to the initial cost. More...

Detailed Description

Management of cost penalties. Try to detect every sub-states that causes a penalty to the initial cost.

bool BotBestPushesS_Penalties::penaltiesListTest ( int *  tab,
int  tabLength,
int *  nodeLimit = NULL,
int  pusherLevelPos = -1 
)

Test the actual sub-node (defined in memory) by creating a temporary level and testing it with every possible pusherZone.

Parameters:
tab tab of cell positions to test
tabLength length of tab
nodeLimit limit of nodes we will use to test. Will be decrease by number of really used nodes
Returns:
true if solver exceed max ram value, false if not.

Sort one nodes list in order of penalty of each node

void BotBestPushesS_Penalties::initPenaltiesList ( int  numberOfBoxes  )  [protected]

Initialize list of penalized sub-nodes in memory. Load it from file if already generated and generate (and store) it if not.

Parameters:
numberOfBoxes number of boxes to put in a level before testing. If every sub-node of "n" boxes is generated, it means every penalties of "n" boxes will be stopped.

void BotBestPushesS_Penalties::createPenaltiesList ( int  numberOfBoxes  )  [protected]

Generate list of penalized sub-nodes in memory and save it in a file.

Parameters:
numberOfBoxes number of boxes to put in a level before testing. If every sub-node of "n" boxes is generated, it means every penalties of "n" boxes will be stopped.

Load list of penalized sub-nodes from a file to memory

void BotBestPushesS_Penalties::increasePenaltiesListTest ( int  positions,
int **  tab,
int *  tabLength 
) [protected]

To test every sub-nodes, we start by testing every boxes positions with only a box. Then we test every boxes positions with 2 boxes, and 3, ... We need to increase positions of boxes in a tab. With 1 box : 1,2,3, ... With 2 boxes : 1,2 | 1,3 | 1,4 | ... | 1,N | 2,3 | 2,4 | ... | N-1,N ... This function increase boxes positions with M boxes and N positions in the level.

Parameters:
positions number of positions we want to increase
tab pointer to tab with all positions
tabLength pointer to length of tab

bool BotBestPushesS_Penalties::lastPenaltiesListTest ( int  positions,
int *  tab,
int  tabLength 
) [protected]

To test every sub-nodes, we start by testing every boxes positions with only a box. Then we test every boxes positions with 2 boxes, and 3, ... We need to increase positions of boxes in a tab. With 1 box : 1,2,3, ... With 2 boxes : 1,2 | 1,3 | 1,4 | ... | 1,N | 2,3 | 2,4 | ... | N-1,N ... This function tell us when positions are last positions of a specific number of boxes. (for 1 box : N, for 2 boxes : N-1,N, for 3 boxes : N-2,N-1,N)

Parameters:
positions number of positions we want to increase
tab pointer to tab with all positions
tabLength pointer to length of tab
Returns:
true if last boxes positions, false if not

int BotBestPushesS_Penalties::validNode ( Node *  node,
int  numOfBoxes,
int  prereq,
int  penaltyDown,
int  penaltyUp,
bool  quickValid = false,
int  maxNodes = INT_MAX 
) [protected]

Test if node penalty if valid for each sub-group of goals If no, this penalty is not a valid penalty because it can break optimality of solution

Parameters:
node node to test
numOfBoxes number of boxes in this node
prereq penalties search already done (num of boxes tested)
penaltyDown penalty already given to this node. New penalty can only be above this value
penaltyUp penalty we want to confirm. Real penalty can only be under this value
quickValid true if valid is done quickly (not test of all goals configurations). It's quick but it can also be non optimal
maxNodes maximum nodes to use to valid
Returns:
valid penalty (if 0, penalty is not valid). if -1, max nodes is reached during validation

bool BotBestPushesS_Penalties::isUselessPenalty ( Level *  l  )  [protected]

If, in a level, the pusher in surrounded by boxes or walls, then it's not usefull to test its penalty

Parameters:
l level we want to test
Returns:
true if this a penalty test is useless on this level, false if not

bool BotBestPushesS_Penalties::ramLimitReached ( char *  message  )  const [protected]

test a return message from a solver.

Returns:
true if message says "Impossible to solve : Ram Limit or Max Nodes Limit reached", false if not

bool BotBestPushesS_Penalties::notResolved ( char *  message  )  const [protected]

test a return message from a solver.

Returns:
true if message says "Impossible to solve : No more nodes in waiting list" or "Impossible to solve : first node has no child", false if not

Base* BotBestPushesS_Penalties::base [protected]

Main class of the game

Solver* BotBestPushesS_Penalties::solver [protected]

deadlock object belang to this solver

Node*** BotBestPushesS_Penalties::pNodes [protected]

List of node representations of penalties sub-nodes. Sorted by number of boxes by sub-nodes. pNodes[i][j] is the (j)th sub-state with (i+1) boxes

int** BotBestPushesS_Penalties::pValues [protected]

penalties values of sub-nodes pValues[i][j] is the (j)th sub-state with (i+1) boxes
